Pre-Game Insights: Thierry Mouyouma and his team landed in Durban on Monday at 6:30 AM and are set to face Lesotho on Tuesday, October 15, 2024, at 14:00 UTC (15:00 Gabon time) at Moses Mabhida Stadium.
The Gabon team departed from Franceville on Sunday at 23:30 after three false starts (13:00, 18:00, and 22:00).
The Gabon team will have a field recognition session on Monday afternoon, followed by a press conference at 14:30.
Jacques Ekomié, the left-back, is absent due to an injury sustained in the match against the Central African Republic and has returned to his club for appropriate treatment.
In the first leg match played last Friday in Franceville, Gabon was held to a draw by Lesotho (0-0) and needs to win at home on Tuesday to keep their qualification hopes for CAN 2025 alive.
